bcl:definition.bcl:text: affiliate has the same meaning as in section 53 of the Act;
control of a corporation has the same meaning as in section 53 of the Act;
processing facility means a facility that processes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: timber or wood residue or both,
products produced from timber or wood residue or both, or
products under both paragraphs (a) and (b);

bcl:definition.bcl:text: secondary processing facility means a processing facility that does not produce, as its primary product, boards, cants, flitches, lumber, veneer, oriented strand board, pulp, paper, newspaper, wood chips, pellets, ground wood, bioenergy, biochemicals or hog fuel.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 3 (3) and 4 (3), a person holds a licence or agreement referred to in those sections if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is an individual or corporation that holds the licence or agreement;
the person is an individual who is in control of a corporation that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: holds the licence or agreement, or
is affiliated with another corporation that holds the licence or agreement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a corporation that is affiliated with another corporation that holds the licence or agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of item 3 in Column 2 of the Table, excluded processing facility, in relation to a processing facility that produces wood chips or ground wood, means a facility to which one or more of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the facility uses the wood chips or ground wood to produce other products at that facility;
the facility is owned by an individual who is in control of a corporation that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: uses the wood chips or ground wood to produce other products at another facility, or
is affiliated with another corporation that uses the wood chips or ground wood to produce other products at another facility;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the facility is owned by a corporation and the corporation is affiliated with another corporation that uses the wood chips or ground wood to produce other products at another facility.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Categories of applicants for restricted forest licences
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 13 (2.1) of the Act, the minister may specify that applications for a non-replaceable forest licence must only be invited from one or more categories of applicants established by section 3 or 4 of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The categories of applicants established by this section are those categories that, subject to subsection (3), result from combining the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one or more types of interest listed in Column 1 of the Table;
one or more types of processing facility listed in Column 2 of the Table;
one of the locations listed in Column 3 of the Table;
one of the annual combined input capacity ranges listed in Column 4 of the Table.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section, each annual combined input capacity range listed in Column 4 of the Table refers to the annual combined input capacity range of all of the processing facilities

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that are of the type,
that are in the location, and
in which an applicant has the type of interest

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: required in order for the applicant to be included in a category established by this section.
A category of applicants established by this section does not include a person that holds any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one or more major licences that are replaceable and together have an aggregate allowable annual cut greater than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 25 000 m3, in the case of a category that includes processing facilities with an annual combined input capacity within the range listed in item 1 in Column 4 of the Table,
50 000 m3, in the case of a category that includes processing facilities with an annual combined input capacity within the range listed in item 2 in Column 4 of the Table,
125 000 m3, in the case of a category that includes processing facilities with an annual combined input capacity within the range listed in item 3 in Column 4 of the Table,
250 000 m3, in the case of a category that includes processing facilities with an annual combined input capacity within the range listed in item 4 in Column 4 of the Table, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 3 or more restricted forest licences;
an agreement referred to in section 12 of the Act the rights in respect of which are under suspension, in whole or in part, under section 76 or 78 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The categories of applicants established by this section are those categories that, subject to subsection (3), result from combining the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one or more types of interest listed in Column 1 of the Table;
one or more types of processing facility listed in Column 2 of the Table, other than the type of processing facility listed in item 5 of that column;
one of the locations listed in Column 3 of the Table;
one of the annual combined input capacity listed in Column 4 of the Table.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), each annual combined input capacity range listed in Column 4 of the Table refers to the annual combined input capacity range of all of the processing facilities

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that are of the type,
that are in the location, and
in which an applicant has the type of interest

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: required in order for the applicant to be included in a category established by this section.
A category of applicants established by this section does not include a person that holds any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 3 or more restricted forest licences;
an agreement referred to in section 12 of the Act the rights in respect of which are under suspension, in whole or in part, under section 76 or 78 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person that applies for a restricted forest licence must provide proof satisfactory to the minister that the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: meets all the requirements in respect of the category of applicants applicable to the person, as specified by the minister in the invitation for applications for the licence, and
is not excluded from a category under section 3 (3) or 4 (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person does not comply with subsection (1), the minister may reject the application without further consideration.
